products.name: terraform-ibm-base-ocp-vpc
products.label: Red Hat OpenShift VPC cluster on IBM Cloud module
products.short_description: Provisions a Red Hat OpenShift VPC cluster on IBM Cloud

features.title: Create a Red Hat OpenShift VPC cluster on IBM Cloud
features.description: Create a Red Hat OpenShift VPC cluster on IBM Cloud.

features.title: Optionally create a Cloud Object Storage instance
features.description: Optionally create a Cloud Object Storage instance which is required by OCP VPC clusters. Also supports using existing instance.

features.title: Attach access tags
features.description: Attach access tags to the cluster resources.

features.title: Enable cluster managed add-ons
features.description: Enable any of the supported [managed cluster addons](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/containers?topic=containers-managed-addons).

features.title: Encrypt data with key management services
features.description: Supports key management encryption (BYOK and KYOK) for boot volumes and cluster data.

diagrams.description: A simple example that shows how to provision a basic single zone OCP VPC cluster.
An advanced example which shows how to create a multi-zone KMS encrypted OCP VPC cluster with custom worker node taints.
This example uses the Profile for IBM Cloud Framework for Financial Services to provision an instance of the base OCP VPC module in a compliant manner.

diagram.caption: 2 MZR clusters in same VPC example

diagrams.description: This is an example of creating 2 MZR clusters in same VPC, and deploying the observability agents in the clusters.
This example will add security rules to the `kube-<vpcid>` and `kube-<clusterId>` security groups.
A single zone OCP VPC cluster configured with KMS encryption for cluster data and worker block storage using a KMS encryption key from another account.
